head.title: Competence - Datair: Artem Zaikin

list_2:
Define Objectives: Determine the purpose of the site (informational, commercial, portfolio, etc.).
 Target Audience Analysis: Understand the needs and expectations of users.
 Competitor Analysis: Review competitors and their sites.
 Create a Brief: A document outlining all requirements and wishes for the site.

Site Architecture: Plan the structure, navigation, and content (site map).
 Wireframing: Create basic page layouts to visualize the structure.
 Design: Develop the graphic design, including color schemes, fonts, images, and overall style.

Front-end Development: Code the design using HTML, CSS, JavaScript. Create the sit's interface.
 Back-end Development: Set up the server-side of the site, program logic, and integrate the database.
 Integration: Combine front-end and back-end parts, and integrate with external services.

Functional Testing: Check all site features against requirements.
 Cross-device Testing: Ensure proper display and functionality on different screen sizes and browsers.
 Bug Fixing: Address any bugs and issues found.

Deployment: Upload the site to the hosting server.
 Domain Setup: Link the domain to the hosting.
 Final Check: Perform a final review of all functions before the official launch.

Search Engine Optimization (SEO): Set up meta tags, keywords, URL structure, etc.
 Marketing: Launch advertising campaigns, promote on social media, content marketing.

Monitoring: Track site performance, user feedback, and errors.
 Updates: Add new content, fix issues, and update security.

list.title: Business Digitalization
list.description: Business digitalization, or simply digitalization, refers to the process of integrating digital technologies and digitized data to transform how a business operates, interacts with customers, and even generates revenue.

list.title: Statement of Work (SOW)
list.description: SOW is a document that outlines the specific tasks, deliverables, and timeline for a project, typically used in the context of a client-vendor or contractor relationship.

body.title: Logistics and Supply Chain Management
body.text: Logistics is the part of supply chain management that deals with the efficient forward and reverse flow of goods, services, and related information from the point of origin to the point of consumption according to the needs of customers.[2][3] Logistics management is a component that holds the supply chain together.[3] The resources managed in logistics may include tangible goods such as materials, equipment, and supplies, as well as food and other edible items. Military logistics is concerned with maintaining army supply lines with food, armaments, ammunition, and spare parts, apart from the transportation of troops themselves. Meanwhile, civil logistics deals with acquiring, moving, and storing raw materials, semi-finished goods, and finished goods. For organisations that provide garbage collection, mail deliveries, public utilities, and after-sales services, logistical problems must be addressed.

body.title: Personal Solution
body.text: Business digitalization, also known as digital transformation, is the process of integrating digital technologies into all areas of a business to fundamentally change how it operates and delivers value. This can involve automating tasks, improving communication and collaboration, enhancing customer experience, and creating new business models. For a personal solution, this translates to leveraging digital tools to streamline your own work, manage your tasks, and improve your productivity
